name: Able
short_description:
This is the reference implementation for the scripting language Able.

Able aims to be an imperative scripting language for running untrusted code.  It is designed to make tight encapsulation easy while permitting patterns of reuse and extension.  To support these goals, it has value semantics, first class mechanisms for controlling access to memory and processor time, and an additive, rather than subtractive, policy toward access to underlying platform features.
summary: Reference implementation for a scripting language for untrusted code
